name: Children that survived past their 5th birthday per woman - based on Gapminder (2015)
title: Children that survived past their 5th birthday per woman - based on Gapminder (2015)
description:
The child mortality rate is the probability that a child born in a specific year will die before reaching the age of five if subject to current age-specific mortality rates.
The child survival rate is 1-child mortality rate
Child survival rate was multiplied by fertility to obtain the data on how many children died on average per woman.

sources.name: Children that survived past their 5th birthday per woman - Gapminder (2015)
sources.dataPublishedBy: This data was calculated by Max Roser based on fertility and child mortality estimates from 1800 to 2015 published by Gapminder.org
sources.dataPublisherSource: The two Gapminder.org datasets used were: Gapminder child mortality estimates version 8, Gapminder Total Fertility Rate estimates version 6
sources.additionalInfo:
The child mortality rate is the probability that a child born in a specific year will die before reaching the age of five if subject to current age-specific mortality rates.
The child survival rate is 1-child mortality rate
Child survival rate was multiplied by fertility to obtain the data on how many children died on average per woman.
